CalibrationGenerator .

Mind that some connectors for HF range are available only if the corresponding option is installed, e.g.
option R&S DDF550-HF, HF Frequency Range Extension (Rx option),
option R&S DDF550-HF2, HF Frequency Range Extension (DF option),
option R&S DDFGTS-HF, HF Frequency Range Extension.

Documentation.p: Selectivity of DF panorama.

Spectral selectivity generally equates to channel spacing (channel bandwidth); DFT length ensues from realtime bandwidth (frequency span) and this spacing. If needed, selectivity can be enhanced by a factor (twice or 4 times, i.e. spectral bins half or fourth as wide) by
Documentation.li: gathering twice or 4 times as many sample values,
deploying a window function prolongated by this factor and then
transforming them to frequency domain by a DFT enhanced accordingly.
Documentation.p: Waiting period for a new spectrum will hence be longer by the same factor.

tr.td: Query parameters for individual DDC (instance of DDC Signal Extraction [DDCE]).
Configure DDC.
Parameter DDCEConfig.eState does not apply in DF mode Scan: DDCEConfig.eState=DDCE_STATE_OFF.

DDCE 1 deactivated,
frequency 98.5 MHz,
DDCE coupling function off,
bandwidth 300 kHz.

Documentation.p:
Through frequency coupling, the distance in frequencies between DDCEConfig.iFrequency (DDCE center frequency) and
MeasureSettingsFFM.iFrequency (main tuner center frequency) will be held constant by the device itself. If
Documentation.li: enabled, the DDCE center frequency will be altered automatically whenever the main tuner center frequency is altered. However, you still can modify DDCEConfig.iFrequency to define a new frequency distance from DDCE center frequency to main tuner center frequency
disabled, the DDCE center frequency remains set even if MeasureSettingsFFM.iFrequency is altered.
Documentation.p:
If a DDC is bound to Short-Time Synthesizer, arbitrary setting of frequency, frequency coupling and bandwidth is disabled. Bandwidth is configured for all DDCs in total with command
ShortTimeSynthesizer instead.
Documentation.li:
Command
MeasureSettingsFFM (configure FFM measure settings),

Command
ShortTimeSynthesizer (configure Short-Time Synthesizer),

Command
DDCEControl (configure all DDCs in total).

Param.name: eState
Param.doc: Activate (enable), deactivate (disable) or bind selected DDCE to Short-Time Synthesizer.

Param.name: eFrequencyCoupling
Param.doc: Switch DDCE coupling function of frequency on or off.

tr.td: Query parameters for all DDCs (instances of DDC Signal Extraction [DDCE]) in total.
Configure all DDCs in total.
Parameter DDCEControl.iSignalDelay does not apply in DF mode Scan.

No transfer of DDCE data,
no IF signal input delay,
no gain control mechanism.

Documentation.p: The state DDCEControl.eGainControl only takes effect when the DDCE bank is configured to deliver samples in 16-bit mode: DDCEControl.eRemoteMode=DDCE_REMOTE_MODE_SHORT. This mode requires a re-quantization of samples to 16 bit resolution (internally a higher resolution is used). With having DDCEControl.eGainControl
Documentation.li: disabled, the output samples get quantized by using the 16 most significant bits; this, however, can result in underflows when processing low-level input signals

enabled, the internally available samples are analyzed per blocks of 240 samples (good for one output frame each) in order to determine a best possible rescaling factor and then scaled before outputting. This assures the 16-bit output width be used as efficiently as possible. Note that the applied rescaling factor causes a modification of the
Data Header field AntennaVoltageRef.RxAttenuation ( AMMOS IF DDCE data stream) in order to assure level accuracy.

Command
DDCEConfig (configure individual DDC).

Param.name: eRemoteMode
Param.doc: Set mode (format 16 bit or 32 bit) of or disable digital IF transfer via remote control interface.

Param.name: iSignalDelay
Param.doc: Set delay [s] (range 0 to 2048: 0 s to 34 min 8 s) of IF signal input to all DDCEs.

Param.name: iSignalDelayCurrent
Param.doc: Return current value [s] used internally (the closest one possible to requested value).

Param.name: eGainControl
Param.doc: Enable or disable selected gain control mechanism applied to create output samples.

tr.td: Query HRPan (High-Resolution Panorama) parameters.
Configure HRPan.

No transfer of HRPan data,
step width selected automatically,
averaging period 655.36 ms,
averaging period used internally 655.36 ms,
granularity for averaging period values 160 µs.

Documentation.p:
Parameter HRPan.iAvgTimeGranularity: When averaging, the unit forms one single spectrum from all individual spectra emerged (calculated internally) within the specified time span. Mind that exact adhering to this desired span length commonly is not achievable, rather the R&S DDFx will use a value as close as possible to the configured one. From that,
HRPan.iAvgTimeGranularity tells the minimum amount of time that HRPan.iAvgTime has to be altered by in order to cause an actual change of averaging time.
Find more detailed information about High-Resolution Panorama and the dedicated data trace HRPan in the R&S DDFx system manual.

Param.name: eMode
Param.doc: Enable data stream HRPAN and set data mode to 16 bit (output spectral level information at 16 bit integer), or disable data stream.

Param.name: eStepAuto
Param.doc: Select HRPan step size (channel spacing) to be set automatically (depending on IF panorama span: on) or explicitly (off).

Param.name: iAvgTimeCurrent
Param.doc: Return current averaging period value [µs] used internally closest possible to requested value.

Param.name: iAvgTimeGranularity
Param.doc: Return current granularity [µs] for averaging period values.

currently used 500 µs to 500 ms,
granularity 100 µs each,

In case of a parameter set used for a scan range ( ShortTimeDetector.iStParamSetId = 1 to 64), all parameters except ShortTimeDetector.eState and .eStepAuto have to be set.
All modifications to input parameters are only taken over when performing a transition of ShortTimeDetector.eState from OFF to ON.

If also using
ShortTimeSynthesizer , it must be enabled before enabling Short-Time Detector.

Command
ScanRange (query or alter settings of existing scan range),

Param.doc: Select detector spectral step size (width of frequency channel) to be set automatically (depending on the IF panorama span: on) or manually (off). Ignored in Scan Mode: only manual setting of step with .eStep .

Param.name: eStep
Param.doc: Specify detector spectral step size. Note: Setting this parameter will disable (off) eStepAuto.

Param.name: iMinTimeCurrent

Param.name: iMinTimeGranularity
Param.doc: Return minimal value [µs] by which minimum duration to be altered in order to change internally used minimum duration.

Param.name: iMaxTime

Param.name: iMaxTimeCurrent

Param.name: iMaxTimeGranularity
Param.doc: Return minimal value [µs] by which maximum duration to be altered in order to change internally used maximum duration.

Param.name: eNoiseThresholdAuto
Param.doc: Select noise threshold to be set automatically (on) or manually (off).

Param.name: iNoiseThreshold
Param.doc: Set threshold [1/10 dB] (range 0 to 2000: 0 dB to 200 dB) for detector logic.

Param.name: iNoiseTime
Param.doc: Set averaging time [µs] (range 1 to 10000000: 1 µs to 10 s) used for frequency dependent spectral noise level estimation of detector.

tr.td: Query calibration settings.
Specify mode for calibration: periodic or after change of DF mode only; and calibration time interval.
Calibration periodically every 30 min.

ul.li:
A calibration is performed in a periodic manner without any further warning. The time interval for re-calibration is told by
CalibrationSettings.iCalibrationTimeInterval.

A calibration is performed only after a change of the DF mode or some other DF parameters or when triggered expressly with command
CalibrationTrigger. CalibrationSettings.iCalibrationTimeInterval in this case tells the validity period of the calibration, i.e., when expired, all DF results will be labeled doubtful until next calibration process.

Documentation.li:

Param.name: iCalibrationTimeInterval
Param.doc: Time interval [min] (range 15 to 60: 15 min to 1 h) for periodically calibrating the R&S DDFx or validity period of calibration.

Program Identifier (4 hexadecimal digits; 0 to FFFF 16=65535)
Traffic Program (1: program with traffic announcements, 0: without)
Traffic Anouncement (1: current emission content not concerning traffic, 0: currently traffic announcement)
Music/Speech (1: currently music, 0: speech)

Decoder Information (4 bit; 0000 2=0 to 1111 2=15):
Bit 0: 0: mono, 1: stereo
Bit 1: 0: conventional stereo, 1: artificial-head stereo
Bit 2: 0: not-compressed FM, 1: compressed FM
Bit 3: 0: PTY (program type) static, 1: PTY switched dynamically

tr.td: Query state of antenna bits mask and of manually set antenna bits (8 antenna bits existing in total; bits set to 1 in mask indicate what antenna bits are set manually).
Configure antenna bits mask and manually set antenna bits that are masked (set to 1) in antenna bits mask.
Set antenna bit 0 to 1, leave all other antenna bits to be set by the normal firmware or FPGA mechanisms.
Controlled by bit 31 (MSB) of each, antenna bits/antenna bits mask may be set in common (bit 31 = 0) or independently (bit 31 = 1) for normal operation and calibration mode (see below).

Documentation.p:
Architecture of iAntennaBits and iAntennaBitsMask (to be configured independently of each other):
Bit 7 to bit 0:
antenna bits/antenna bits mask for normal operation
also antenna bits/antenna bits mask for calibration (if bit 31 = 0)
Bit 15 to bit 8:
not in use (if bit 31 = 0)
antenna bits/antenna bits mask for calibration (if bit 31 = 1)
Bit 30 to bit 16:
not in use
Bit 31:
enabling bit
Example 1: with iAntennaBitsMask= 0000001F 16 , the antenna bits mask will be 1F 16 in normal operation and for calibration.
Example 2: with iAntennaBitsMask= 8000301F 16 , the antenna bits mask will be 1F 16 in normal operation and 30 16 for calibration.

Param.name: iAntennaBits
Param.doc: Value to assign to the antenna bits manually (bits opened by the antenna bits mask only, all others remain unchanged).

Param.name: iAntennaBitsMask
Param.doc: Antenna bits mask to open antenna bits to be set or reset manually: set (1) bits to open, reset (0) to prevent from modifying.

Command.name: AntennaLevelSwitch
Command.Documentation:
GET:
Query whether antenna level indications are output and whether antenna test radiator is active.
SET:
Enable or disable output of antenna level indications and switch antenna test radiator.
Conditions:
Not during activated trigger mode: only allowed with
TriggerSettings.eTriggerMode==DFTRIGGERMODE_DISABLED).
Example:
No output of antenna level indications,
antenna test radiator not active.
Normal DF operation only possible if antenna element test/antenna cable test switched off.
The count of channels per hop
MeasureSettingsFFM.eSpan / eDfPanStep
is limited to 3200 if test enabled (attempts to do inconsistent settings will be rejected).
See also:
Command
MeasureSettingsFFM (configure FFM measure settings),
Command
TriggerSettings (state and mode of triggered measuring),
Enum
eTRIGGER_MODE (state of triggered measuring mode).

Set calibration switch.
Example:
Antenna "ADD153SR" (R&S ADD153SR),
signal from antenna.
Normal DF operation only possible if switched to antenna.

Param.doc: Position of calibration switch: get input signal from antenna or from calibration generator.

Command.name: Memtest
Command.Documentation:
GET:
Query results of type of memory test specified (CPU or FPGA) and return date when last test has been performed.
SET:
Trigger type of memory test specified.
Example:
Memory test off,
result of memory test: successful,
date: December 1st, 2017.
Initiate either a test of the CPU memory or of the FPGA memory (RAMs).
Peculiarities:
An FPGA memory test (R&S DDF1GTX only) takes about 30 s.
A CPU memory test might last up to 60 min: hence 1 hour.
During a memory test commands will not be accepted by the DF unit.
A memtest always starts with a reboot.
The front panel display will show STARTING APPLICATION during a memory test.
If necessary, a memory test can be aborted by a power off/on; in no case a memory test will be started automatically after power-up.
After completion of the memtest, a testpoint DDR_TQ8560 will be created showing the memtest result.
Query the memtest result by the GET option of this command.
Result:
eResult=MEMTEST_RESULT_PASS: all memory cells OK.
eResult=MEMTEST_RESULT_FAIL: at least one cell defective.
In the "Fail" case, any client connecting newly to the unit immediately receives a corresponding error message.

Param.name: eType
Param.doc: Specify type of memory test; SET: trigger type of memory test specified; GET: query results of type of memory test specified.

Param.name: eResult
Param.doc: Memory test result: successful, unsuccessful or aborted.

Param.name: zDate
Param.doc: Date (12 chars max.) of memory test.

tr.td: Query antenna control mode, antenna signal inputs and HF border frequency.
Select antenna control mode, antenna signal inputs and HF border frequency.

Antenna control mode Auto,
signal input VHF/UHF/SHF: V/U/SHF1 (X21 to X23),
signal input HF: HF1 (X11 to X13).

ul.li: RF inputs set by the fields AntennaControl.eRfInput and AntennaControl.iHfInput.
No DF result correction (antenna error correction) data in use in any case.

li.i: Recommended only for single antenna connected to the R&S DDFx with no correction data to be used.

ul.li: RF inputs set according to the settings in AntennaSetup.
DF result correction (antenna error correction) data can be used.

li.i: Strongly recommended with more than one antenna connected to the R&S DDFx and when using correction data.

tr.td: Query currently used antenna.
Antenna "ADD153SR" (R&S ADD153SR) currently in use.
Send compass command string to antenna compass.
Command works only for antenna compasses; find antenna compass commands listed in antenna compass manual.

td.p:
Send string to compass:
" GH150@ADD153SR": R&S GH150 mounted to antenna R&S ADD153SR.
" ?w": query of compass information.

Return string from compass: " >?w 4100014,D,C,C100,04/10/14*2D"
prompt sign '>': command accepted,
repeated command "?w",
serial number "4100014",
software version 'D',
hardware version 'C',
hardware type "C100",
manufacturer calibration done on October 14th, 2004,
separation character "*",
hexadecimal checksum "2D".

tr.td: Query sweeptime (time period from processing an individual frequency to processing it the next time).
Query sweeptime, result: 409.261552 ms.
Continue search with next frequency.
Only with DF mode Search (rejected with an error message if received in any other mode).
Continue search with next frequency.

Documentation.p:
Search Mode proceeds from one frequency to another; if the level on a frequency has been found to be above the level threshold, a temporary FFM will be entered. This FFM may be sustained with the
Command
Hold .
The
Command Continue
leaves the temporary FFM in any case, whether regular or sustained, and proceeds to the subsequent frequency immediately.
For more detailed information refer to R&S DDFx system manual.
Documentation.li:
Command
SearchTimes (query or alter timings of Search Mode).

tr.td: Sustain temporary FFM (inhibit continuing search with next frequency).
Only with DF mode Search (rejected with an error message if received in any other mode).
Sustain temporary FFM.

Documentation.p:
Mind hints given with
Command
Continue .
FFM will also be terminated by selecting another DF mode with
Command
DfMode .

Set mode and contents of AUX control port.

AUX control mode antenna,
output value 7 to port (pin 28 to pin 32 reset, pin 33 to pin 35 set).

i.b: Never insert signals from outside to the pins themselves!

ul.li: Output current Rx frequency (frequency value in MHz) in BCD format.
If frequency value exceeds 99 MHz, its tens place and ones place are output, however: hundreds and higher places stay eliminated.
This output is adopted from other Rohde&Schwarz devices, its usefulness is limited from that.
Use settings of AntennaSetup, field AntennaSetup.iCtrlPort.

Command.name: CorrectionState
Command.Documentation:
GET:
Query currently used DF correction data.
SET:
Enable or disable DF correction data (which correction data sets / type of correction to be used).
See R&S DDFx system manual and DF Error Correction manual for further information.
Conditions:
Only with DF mode Rx (rejected with an error message if received in any other mode).
Example:
Antenna factor correction in use,
omniphase correction in use,
cable attenuation in use,
azimuth correction in use,
attitude correction in use (consider nautical angles).
Parameter CorrectionState.bCorrectAttitude does not insert additional correction data, but decides whether the nautical angles (ship deviations) be considered or not.

Param.name: bCorrectAntFactor
Param.doc: Antenna factor correction (true: enabled, false: disabled).

Param.name: bCorrectAttitude
Param.doc: Attitude correction (true: consider nautical angles, false: do not consider).

tr.td: Query UDP port number (used for receiving NMEA 0183 sentences via UDP).
Set UDP port number.
UDP port number 10110.

Documentation.p: To send an NMEA 0183 sentence via UDP, store entire sentence (i.e. starting with '$' and ending with 'CR''LF') in UDP datagram.
Sentences supported are (first 2 [unless noted otherwise] to 4 chars: unit ID, last 3 chars: type-of-data ID):

ul.li: GPS: Global Positioning System Fix Data (time, position and fixed related data for a GPS receiver)
GPS: GPS DOP ( dilution of precision) and active satellites
GPS: Recommended Minimum Navigation Information, Type C
Heading Compass: Water Speed and Heading
Proprietary Rohde&Schwarz ( private identifier: 3 chars unit ID): heading, roll and pitch angle
Proprietary Anschütz ( private identifier: 4 chars unit ID): heading, roll and pitch angle

Documentation.p: See R&S DDFx system manual and relevant publications for more details on supported NMEA 0183 sentences.
Documentation.li:

eGPS_CODE (type of GPS receiver connected).

tr.td: Query system reference (10 MHz reference frequency) mode.
Set system reference mode.
External system reference in use (supplied to REF IN connector).
Reset the R&S DDFx.
Perform a warm reset.

If the device is operating with external reference clock, a warm reset will switch it to internal clock; completing this switching will take some seconds. The actual reset (setting the default values) will only be executed after the (internal) reference oscillator has settled completely. Hence all user settings possibly performed between initiating and entirely having executed the reset will be void (overwritten).

ul.li: All device settings will be reset to their factory defaults, but R&S DDFx will keep on running (will not be rebooted).
Forces reboot of main processor, closes all communications interfaces, but does not reset the device settings to factory defaults.

li.i: A warm reset is useful for starting a firmware update procedure using the Update32 tool.

ul.li: Forces reboot of main processor, closes all communications interfaces and resets all device settings to factory defaults.

tr.td: Query RF mode (preselection mode).
Set RF (preselection) mode (see below).
Preselection mode Normal.

i.b: Preselection mode with different Rx conditions:

p.p: The Preselection module contains a selectable amplifier ahead of and one following each of the partly tuned range filters.

ul.li: RF path settings optimized for both good noise figure and good high-level signal characteristics (Rx bandwidth limited ahead of the amplifier).
Preselection filter active; low noise amplifier (LNA, in case of frontend 4093.1514.08, see "LOW NOISE") bypassed.
Best linearity, but increases noise figure. RF path settings optimized for best large-signal immunity.

li.i: Especially recommended for areas with plenty of strong signals.

ul.li: Preselection filter not active; LNA instead of preselection filter active from 650 MHz up to improve noise figure at higher frequencies.
RF path settings optimized for best noise figure, but amplifier is hit by full signal power of antenna input. This weakens large-signal immunity, especially concerning 2nd degree interferences.

li.i: Strongly recommended for areas where no high-level signals exist in the input frequency range of 20 MHz to 6 GHz.
Restriction: only with frontend 4093.1514.08: R&S DDF550 and R&S DDF5GTS model 08/18. Not for HF Frequency Extension (options R&S DDF550-HF, R&S DDF550-HF2 and R&S DDFGTS-HF). Not for R&S DDF1GTX.

Command.name: TriggerSettings
Command.Documentation:
GET:
Query mode(s) and source of triggered measurement.
SET:
Select mode(s) and source.
Conditions:
No scan ranges must be defined before entering trigger mode time synchronous scan ( TriggerSettings.eTriggerMode=DFTRIGGERMODE_TIMESYNC), thus first delete all existing scan ranges (
ScanRangeDeleteAll ).
During antenna radiator test (
AntennaLevelSwitch.eAntLevelSwitch≠ANTLEVEL_OFF), trigger mode must be disabled ( TriggerSettings.eTriggerMode=DFTRIGGERMODE_DISABLED).
Example:
Triggered measurement disabled,
trigger source is trigger,
one single measurement per trigger event.
See also:
Command
ScanRangeDeleteAll (delete all existing scan ranges),
Command
AntennaLevelSwitch (output of antenna level indications and switch antenna test radiator),
Enum
eANTLEVELSWITCH (mode of antenna operation).
If the R&S DDFx has been set to a triggered measuring mode, a single measurement will be performed on any trigger event.

Param.name: eTriggerMode
Param.doc: Triggered measurement mode (disabled, external or Synchronous Scan).
